Method Detail

activate

public void activate()
Description copied from interface: Initializing
Invoked by the container after it has set all bean properties supplied (and satisfied ProviderAware and DefinitionAware). This method allows the bean instance to perform initialization only possible when all bean properties have been set.

Specified by:
activate in interface Initializing
Overrides:
activate in class AbstractBasePooling

addObject

public void addObject()
               throws java.lang.Exception,
                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Description copied from interface: PoolType
Creates an object using the implementation dependent mechanism, passivate it, and then place it in the idle object pool. addObject is useful for "pre-loading" a pool with idle objects. (Optional operation).

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when creation fails.
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when this pool cannot add new idle objects.

close

public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: PoolType
Close this pool, and free any resources associated with it.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - implementations should silently fail if not all resources can be freed.

obtainObject

public java.lang.Object obtainObject()
                              throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                     java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: PoolType
Obtains an instance from this pool.

The behaviour of this method when the pool has been exhausted is not strictly specified (although it may be specified by implementations). This method will return null to indicate exhaustion or throw a NoSuchElementException.

Returns:
an instance from this pool.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - when the pool is exhausted and cannot or will not return another instance.
java.lang.Exception
